subject: Retrieve userGroups Information ("AccountTypes")
commitMessage:
Retrieve userGroups Information ("AccountTypes")

This commit enhances the redfish API to retrieve userGroups information
for each user account.

"Redfish" is always enabled in each user role. That's why it was
hardcoded into JSON response data in the old redfish API, where now it
gets retrieved using dbus interface xyz.openbmc_project.User.Attributes.
UserGroups.

UserGroups retrieve data are "redfish", "ssh", "web", and "ipmi", where
redfish DMTF Schema has predefined enum type as described below.

  "AccountTypes": {
    "enum":["Redfish", "SNMP", "OEM", "HostConsole", "ManagerConsole",
            "IPMI", "KVMIP", "VirtualMedia", "WebUI"]
   }

Here UserGroups ssh is mapped with two AccountTypes "HostConsole",
"ManagerConsole".

  - Redfish ManagerConsole == SSH to port 22 == Phosphor User manager
    Phosphor “ssh” privilege
  - Redfish HostConsole == SSH to port 2200 (host console), Which
    OpenBMC implements using the Phosphor User manager Phosphor “ssh”
    privilege.

Test:

Pass Redfish Service Validator

curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X GET https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/
AccountService/Accounts/admin
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/AccountService/Accounts/admin",
  "@odata.type": "#ManagerAccount.v1_4_0.ManagerAccount",
  "AccountTypes": [
    "IPMI",
    "Redfish",
    "HostConsole",
    "ManagerConsole"
  ],
  "Description": "User Account",
  "Enabled": true,
  "Id": "admin",
  "Links": {
    "Role": {
      "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/AccountService/Roles/Administrator"
    }
  },

    ...
    ...
}

Signed-off-by: Abhishek Patel <Abhishek.Patel@ibm.com>
Change-Id: Iaa9b6c07b3d26e8994be28a50c22437e0bc9bc8f

Not in the schema.  Please read and understand the redfish schema before submitting this again.  I see below that you haven't run the service validator, which would've immediately caught this issue.  Please make sure your path is correct before you submit it again.

"ssh" UserGroup controls access to Manager Console and Host Console? Host Console is sshing to port 2200? Manager Console is sshing to port 22? 
Can you add more detail here?
please follow the other examples of how to map enums in Redfish.  This requires persistent memory and mallocs on startup as written, which is not good.
Please abstract this logic to its own method.
If the account fails to map, we need to return internal error.
nit, remove this.  We can see the lookup table in the code.

Actually, I don't mind having this in the commit msg and actually I don't think you should remove because "we can look up in the code", IMO if you remove it, it should be because you have already stated this in the commit msg. Let me explain more. 

I read the commit msg then do the code review. So this helps in what I am "expecting from the code", but since you already mention anything unexpected in the mapping "ssh is mapped with two AccountTypes ..." and you already mention what user groups you are mapping above ""redfish", "ssh", "web", and "ipmi"" this is redundant. Up to you if you want to keep.

Sure, I'm ok with it.  I don't like the duplication of information, and IMO, it can lead to people reading the commit message and not the code;  With that said, if it's helpful to you, it doesn't hurt much to have, so it's fine as is.

This kind of points out that we mapped this incorrectly.  I would expect the Manager console to be assigned to Administrators only, with the Host console being assigned to operators and administrators.  It seems odd we used the same privilege for both.

I agree 100%.  But the mapping looks correct for what we have in phoshor-user-manager today and how I understand the D-Bus UserGroup's. 

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-user-manager/blob/18c1b42c1612e0e8d8f5cd9973bba09b447c7185/user_mgr.hpp#L202

I.e. I think we need a larger change in phoshor-user-manager to split the ssh user group

> 
> I.e. I think we need a larger change in phoshor-user-manager to split the ssh user group

+1
Comments from Ed in the code need addressed
Like i said above, please do this the way we've been doing other things (look for examples), but even such, this is a map, and as you wrote it, you should be using find, not iterating the whole map.
You're 8 scoped deep here.  Please refactor to make the code readable.

There might be some confusion. It looks like you are enhancing/violating the redfish API.
(Based on a quick control f for "AccountTypes" in 
https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/ManagerAccountCollection.json)

The maintainers will not let you do that. 
They might let you add an oem field, if your attempts to modify the redfish spec are rejected.

AccountTypes is the explicit type defined in the CSDL.  FYI, you're looking at the collection, not the ManagerAccount schema as you probably meant to.  Assuming you want the json, you should ideally be looking at:
https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/ManagerAccount.v1_8_1.json

Which does have an AccountTypes field.  FWIW, I tend to look at the CSDL, as it doesn't have this "every version is a different file" weirdness, and it's what the json schema is generated from:

https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/ManagerAccount_v1.xml

In short, your comment about OEM schemas is correct, it's just that this isn't an OEM schema.
Maybe this check is not needed? If user is in a group not listed above, simply ignore it is okay I think. Some vendors may have their own OEM group.

OEM Group applies here? Can you explain more?
http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/ManagerAccount.json#/definitions/AccountTypes
where I see only predefined strict account types.
and if there is Oem account type then it has to be in {"Oem": {"openbmc": {"OemAccountype":"xxx"}}} group.

Please explain if I am wrong.

In redfish schema, if there is a OEM user group, an "OEM" need to be put in "AccountTypes", and detailed groups are shown in "OEMAccountTypes".
https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP2046_2021.4.html#manageraccount-181

Sorry I misunderstood it in my first comment, giving out the error is fine. It's vendor's responsibility to patch this file to support their own groups. Thank you for your detailed explanation.
Did you mean Redfish Service Validator?
Looks good to me, modulo "ssh" mapping to ["HostConsole", "ManagerConsole"] which we should fix in a separate multi-repository commit.
nit: you can remove this comment, it's quite obvious

Usually bmcweb handles error at the level of async method call. This allows to stop procedure early and prevent situation when response contains partial information and error message.

You can return false here and set internal ereor in calling scope.
Here I am passing res reference into that method because this method converts and creates JSON response. So that's why I am responding to errors in that method.

Most of the error are usually handled in BMCWEB_ROUTE so for consistency internalError should be set there. You can still fill AccountType and print debug message here. We can wait for Ed or Gunnar response whatever they agree with my suggestion.
you should check pointer before passing it to function also since you will check it here you can pass it via const& instead of pointer
I am checking inside that translateUserGroup function

You should check pointers as early as possible and once checked pass value by reference to other functions. That the usual patterns in bmcweb, you can see that properties above are handled in that manner so it will also make code more consistent.
as a design pattern, Krzysztof is correct, it's better to handle your errors early.  In terms of correctness, both are equally valid.

Some questions on the "web" group, and how I can't imagine it works the way redfish expects it to work, a minor formatting change;

Still waiting on the SSH host vs BMC cleanups (breaking into two groups) to be done so this can land.
This `std::optional` seems to be unnecessary here.
It's necessary to be able to return invalid, which this code isn't currently doing.

Here this fuction returns empty vector for when not match, the caller should check if the return value is an empty vector instead of std::nullopt.

Of course, if this funtion returns std::nullopt, then this std::optioal is necessary.

At an interface level how does this group even work properly?  The webui is logging in via redfish, so I would expect the redfish and web groups to be the same.  If this group is missing, does the webui no longer work?
I tested looks like it is still working. user able to access Web-UI
Disable the webui group, but leave the redfish group enabled.  As the code is written, the user will still be able to log in.
Please invert this check to save vertical space.
